ADAS.description: Retrieves the name of the Detected Object that triggered the wait function.
Waits for a Detected Object for which the distance is above/below a specified value
Waits for a Detected Object for with a speed above/below a specified value.
Waits for the occurrence of the first Detected Object matching the Time To Impact (TTI) conditions passed as arguments.
Waits for the occurrence of the first Moving Object matching the distance conditions passed as arguments.
Waits for the occurrence of the first Moving Object matching the distance conditions passed as arguments.
Waits for a Moving Object which is completely in the given lane.
Waits for a Moving Object which is completely in the lane of the ego vehicle.
Waits for a Moving Object which switches lane.
Waits for the occurrence of the first Moving Object matching the speed conditions passed as arguments.
Waits for the occurrence of the first Moving Object matching the Time To Collision (TTC) conditions passed as arguments.

AUTOSAR PDU.description: Calls up the content of a PDU.
Calls up the content of a message, packet or frame of a PDU.
Completes the current set of "joined events" with the transmitted event.
Waits for the occurrence of the specified PDU.

Collection of Event Information.description: Retrieves the occurrence and the occurrence time of a joined event.
Indicates the period of time for which the last wait function executed had to wait until being triggered.
Makes he last occurred return value of a TestWait instruction available.
Returns the result of the last successful call of TestWaitForStringInput.
Returns the result of the last successful call of TestWaitForValueInput.
Calls up the message content.
Retrieves the system variable value that has led to the resume of a joined wait statement.
If a Ethernet packet is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the packet's content can be called up.
If a valid SOME/IP message is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the SOME/IP message content can be called up.
If a valid SOME/IP Service Discovery entry is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the content of the SOME/IP Service Discovery entry can be called up.
If a valid FlexRay frame is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the frame's content can be called up.
If a FlexRay frame error is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the event's content can be called up.
If a FlexRay Null Frame is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the frame's content can be called up.
If a valid FlexRay PDU is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the PDU's content can be called up.

If an event indicating a change of state on the FlexRay Communication Controller's protocol operation state machine is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the event's content can be called up.
If a FlexRay start cycle is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the event's content can be called up.
If a FlexRay symbol event is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the event's content can be called up.
Retrieves the data of a checksum error.
If LIN LongDominantSignal is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the frame content can be called up with this function.
Calls up the event content.
Calls up the header content.
Calls up the error content.
If LIN Spike is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the frame content can be called up with tis function.
Retrieves the data of a synchronization error.
Calls up the frame content.
Retrieves the data of Scope event.

Starts an analysis for the defined bit segments for each bit, which is within the defined range.
Waits for the occurrence of Scope event.

The defined frame cutout is shown in the scope's graph view. (FlexRay)
The defined frame cutout of the previously transition time measurement frame together with a bitmask is shown in the scope's graph view.

Checks the bits of a message against the defined bitmask.
Export the scope measurement.
Request the analysis data for a single bit.
After a signal was analyzed, the average values of the voltages of CAN_H, CAN_L, and CAN_Diff are calculated for a defined bit range.
Used to request the analysis data for a violation found with the eye diagram analysis
Retrieve the data of the bitmask violations.
Gets specific bit values from a message.
Measures different edge parameters for falling or rising edges of a frame or node.
Used to check bits against a defined bitmask.
Checks the bits of a message against the defined bitmask.
Measures the transition time of rising and falling edges of a message within the defined area on bit level.
The defined frame cutout together with a previously defined bitmask is shown in the scope's graph view.
If a J1939 parameter group event is the last event that triggers a wait instruction, the message content can be called up.
Waits until a defined Parameter Group and a defined Diagnostic Trouble Code (DTC) is received or a timeout occurred.

Waits for the occurrence of the valid specified A429 message.

OEM Add-on Based Fault Injection Functio.description: Disables the CRC calculation of a message.

Enables the CRC calculation of a message.

Calculates the corresponding CRC checksum based on the payload.
Controls the cyclic timing of PDUs. The cyclic timing can be enabled/ disabled.
Controls the event triggered timing of PDUs. The event triggered timing can be enabled/ disabled.

Test Report.description: Within a test case a commentary can be taken over into the report.
Returns the ID of the current test case.
Returns the name of the current test case.
Returns the name of the test configuration.
Returns the name of the test unit.
Information pairs of name and description can be taken up into the report in the areas TestEngineer, TestSetUp, and device (SUT).

Marks a test case as unexecuted.

Sets a precondition to be fulfilled.

The title of the test module is acquired automatically from the name of the test node in the simulation structure.
Sets a precondition to be fulfilled.
Sets the title of the current test sequence.

Test Structuring.description: Describes a test step which can not clearly marked as passed or failed .
Reports a test step that was executed as expected.
Describes a test case that was executed without errors but whose result could contribute to a problem later on.
